controller

Class CustomKeyListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.CustomKeyListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class CustomKeyListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.io.Serializable
    CustomKeyListener handles all KeyEvents during the game.

    For some reason you must alt+tab out and back, then click on the game for the KeyEvents to occur. Pretty much only used for debugging.

    Author:
    W Mathieu Mimms-Boyce, Miguel Fuentes
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Handles actions for when the key has been pressed.

        The only keyPress checked for is

        • ESC - Exits game
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e - The KeyEvent

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Handles actions for when a key is released. These were placed here so that holding a key down would not repeatedly perform an action

        Saving and Loading

        • S - Saves State
        • L - Loads State

        Debugging Keys

        • Shift + D - Toggles Debug
        • Q - Catches current Target on Estuary Screen
        • W - Reseraches Fish on Research Screen
        • E - Skips to Quiz with all fishes caught
        • R - Skips to Quiz with current fishes caught
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e - The KeyEvent

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Specified by:

      • toggleDebugging

        public void toggleDebugging()
        Toggles debugging to the opposite of what it presently is.
